text: Sauté the aromatics. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and carrot, and sauté for 4 to 5 minutes, until softened. Add the diced potato and cook for 2 minutes more.
label: step

text: Add the spices. Add the garlic, tomato paste, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper, and stir for another 30 seconds.
label: step

text: Simmer the lentils. Add the lentils and broth, bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, until the lentils and potatoes are very soft.
label: step

text: Blend. Use an immersion blender to blend until smooth. (Note: Turkish home cooks usually blend it completely, though you can make it as smooth or textured as you'd like).
label: step

text: Make the pepper butter. In a small pan, melt the butter over low heat. Add the Aleppo pepper and stir for 20 to 30 seconds, until fragrant.
label: step

text: Serve. Ladle the soup into bowls, drizzle with the pepper butter, and serve with lemon wedges on the side.
label: step
